reviews.review_msg: Ken is a great dude and his lectures are always fun to attend, even though he cold calls on people. He's also a tough grader, but follow the feedback he gives on assignments and you'll do fine. I wish he adjusted his lectures to emphasize on skills most students struggle with (i.e. forming a proper thesis), but I would take him again if I could.

He talks about the same things in class, every lecture is basically the same. He gives harsh-ish feedback, but doesn't help with things the class is collectively bad at but complains about the average.With less assignments, it'd harder to know how to get better on his terms. He puts you on the spot and openly hates your work in tutorials.

dude, idk what to say but THE best prof i've had @ sfu, ken is not ken, he is barbie. genuinely made me wanna do better on my essays, participation never made me more excited (im an intro-introvert), going to his class was SO much fun, his literature collection is amazing! he's also funny, 100/10 recommended, pls take his class you won't regret it!

Really intriguing and engaging lectures. Inspired me and made me realize I write well. Gives honest feedback. He will push you to participate and to think in different ways. Would recommend for people skilled at or interested in writing and analyzing stories and people open to improving their skills and having their perspectives challenged.

Ken is a pretty cool guy, his lectures can be heavy but if you show up and put work in the course shouldn't be too hard. Participation does matter and he cold calls on people in lecture and tutorial which i wasn't really a fan of. His office hours are a great place to talk to him about your work he provides really clear feedback.

BEWARE: he calls on people in lecture and tutorial with no warning. Also it's just generally an extremely frustrating class to be in because it doesn't really feel like he welcomes new ideas or different viewpoints. That said, I appreciate his passion for world lit and he's also unintentionally hilarious so he's not all bad.

Easily one of my favourite profs, classes were very interesting and dynamic, very discussion heavy which made it easy to apply what was learned in each class (but you do have to be ready to participate if you want a good grade). I was never a fan of class participation but Seigneurie made it feel far less difficult.

Ken is a really great prof! Super passionate and caring and gives really good feedback on essays. Be sure to participate in lectures and tutorials as it is a bit of your grade. Also, there is quite a bit of reading, but the short stories covered are pretty interesting.

Ken is a fantastic teacher. He is very passionate and knowledgeable about the class and above all he cares that each student learns the material well. He is super accessible outside of class. I have yet to have a teacher that is as caring and passionate as him. It is essential that you attend class and read the stories but overall a great class.
Really great prof for teaching the basics of writing, how to read, and literature in general. You MUST attend lectures. Everything he'll ask of you he'll teach in class in a really accessible way.
